hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Volatility Compression & Positive Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes, when 10-day realized volatility compresses below its 30-day moving average while BTC price forms a higher low and the Cumulative Volume Delta (CVD) turns positive for 3 consecutive days, the regime will transition to NEUTRAL within 3-7 days with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear regimes typically end with volatility compression as selling pressure exhausts. Higher lows indicate demand absorption, while positive CVD shows actual buying pressure. Declining OI suggests weak shorts covering rather than new speculative positioning, creating conditions for stabilization.
entry_conditions: 10-day realized volatility < 30-day MA of realized volatility
BTC price forms higher low (confirmed over 48h)
Open Interest declines by 10-20% from recent peak

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below recent swing low or regime remains BEAR after 7 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such patterns lead to continuation of BEAR regime or immediate transition to STRESS regime instead of NEUTRAL.
